Library
“City libraries are becoming more and more popular with residents every year. Their funds contain both books by modern popular authors and old editions dating from the 16th-19th centuries. However, libraries have long ceased to be read-only places. Today, here you can listen to a concert and play musical instruments, learn a foreign language, and also work or do research. The demand for libraries among citizens is growing due to the emergence of convenient services.”

How to use libraries
Now there are more than four hundred libraries. To use all the services of any of these libraries, you only need to issue a single library card. This document - a plastic or electronic card - confirms the reader's right to simultaneously use the services of all libraries. You can apply for a single library card online. If desired, a plastic card can be obtained at the library by presenting an electronic version of a library card and an identity document.
How to get a single library card? You can get a single library card: by contacting any of the libraries with a passport or other identity document; or online using the service. Please note that for the child you need to issue his own single library card. Children over 14 can do it themselves. If the child is under 14 years old, in order to issue a single library card, you and your child need to contact the library convenient for you. Take your passport or other identification document with you, as well as the child's birth certificate or other document confirming kinship. Regardless of whether you are issuing a library card for yourself or for a child, you must complete and sign an application for a library and information service agreement, which includes consent to the processing of personal data, agreement with the rules for using libraries and policies regarding processing personal data of each library, as well as take a photo of the owner of a single library card to confirm that you belong to the created account. You do not need to wait several days to issue a single library card - it will be issued in front of you on the day you apply.
No, registration is not required to use the services of Moscow libraries. The issuance of a single library card is carried out for all citizens, regardless of registration at the place of residence or place of stay, as well as for foreign citizens and stateless persons.
If you have lost your card, you need to apply for a duplicate at any library under the jurisdiction of the Department of Culture of the city. You must have an identity document with you. A duplicate will be made in your presence on the day you apply.
In addition to lending books and magazines at home and using them in the reading room, libraries provide other services. Among them may be: access to electronic publications from the library and the National Electronic Library; free Wi-Fi; computers with access to local and remote electronic resources; workplaces with sockets for connecting personal laptops (tablets) of readers; the ability to listen to sound recordings and view video recordings; access to electronic libraries of periodicals, reference and information systems on legislation and topical issues of law, an electronic library of dissertations, electronic library systems; bibliographic services. Also, in many libraries, you can additionally attend sections and circles. Meetings with writers, master classes, lectures, excursions and other events are held on a gratuitous and paid basis.
Yes. If you have forgotten your library card, you can present your passport or a social card linked to the reader's profile (if available) when visiting the library. In addition, you can present an electronic library card saved in the personal account of the reader of the service.
The service is available to readers. With the help of the service, readers can find books online and reserve them in the selected library. The service contains a reader's personal account, in which the user can view the list of borrowed books with the possibility of extending their use, the list of orders, the status of their readiness, and cancel the order if necessary. Also, readers have the opportunity to create lists of favorite books for quick access to them.
You will need a single library card and a full/standard account. Select a book and a suitable library on the map, log in, enter your library card number and place an order. After successful registration, the order is prepared for issue in the selected library within 3 days (in some cases, the order preparation time can be extended up to 7 days). As soon as the order is formed, you will receive a notification in the reader's personal account and can pick up the order within 3 days. At the same time, there can be no more than 15 books in orders and on hand.
Libraries lend books for up to 30 days, but rare items may ask for a return earlier. The date of issue will be formed when you pick up the order in the library.
